verses.roman:
vyuṣṭāyāṁ niśi kauravya
sūrye cādbhyaḥ samutthite
kārayām āsa vai kaṁso
malla-krīḍā-mahotsavam

synonyms: vyuṣṭāyām—having passed; niśi—the night; kauravya—O descendant of Kuru (Parīkṣit); sūrye—the sun; ca—and; adbhyaḥ—from the water; samutthite—rising; kārayām āsa—had carried out; vai—indeed; kaṁsaḥ—Kaṁsa; malla—of wrestlers; krīḍā—of the sport; mahā-utsavam—the great festival.
translation: When the night had finally passed and the sun rose up again from the water, Kaṁsa set about arranging for the grand wrestling festival.
